name: Blood Orange Smoothie With Grapes and Red Quinoa
description: I had never considered using red grapes in a smoothie until I began working on pairing fruit with grains in this week’s Recipes for Health. Red grapes and red quinoa are a perfect match. I used blood orange juice as the liquid and sweetened it with a bit of pomegranate molasses. As the mixture was whirling in the blender it occurred to me that a small handful of kale would be welcome; it would darken the color slightly and contribute all that kale has to offer without distorting the sweet/tannic flavor of the drink. The second time I made the smoothie I froze the grapes, which is a great idea. Then you won’t have to dilute the flavors with ice.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup red seedless grapes, preferably frozen (6 ounces)
1 cup blood orange juice (or regular orange juice if blood oranges are not available)

recipeInstructions.text: Place all of the ingredients in the jar of a blender and blend at high speed until smooth. Serve right away.
